title: I need an awesome Dubstep song!

replies.body:
That's Drumstep. Dubstep has a half-step beat and has a lower tempo than that of drumstep due to it being 130 to 150 BPM (beats per minute) other than it usually being around 140-145 BPM. It is of a different genre and origin and is a sub of EDM (Both drumstep and dubstep). Drumstep is different and is Breakdown VIP due to the fact it uses between 160 to 180 BPM with a half-step beat, so essentially dubstep but faster tempoed based off the elements of Dubstep and Drum 'n' Bass. Dubstep is notorious for *chh shh* and drumstep is *chh chh____chh shh*. If you meant the original breakdown, it is located here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1aov6gXO1Qs.

tl;dr VIP is drumstep, original is dubstep
replies.body_tagged:

Drumstep is different and is Breakdown VIP due to the fact it uses between 160 to 180 BPM with a half-step beat, so essentially dubstep but faster tempoed based off the elements of Dubstep and Drum 'n' Bass. Dubstep is notorious for *chh shh* and drumstep is *chh chh____chh shh*. If you meant the original breakdown, it is located here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1aov6gXO1Qs.

replies.body:
@OP When in doubt, Monstercat.

Dubstep Good for montages and milestone videos.
Drumstep Good for achievement videos or fast-paced gameplay.
Drum and Bass Good for fast paced gameplay.
Trance Good for very long videos or just wanting to have a calm atmosphere.
Nu Disco Get funky! Really welcoming and fun vibes for your fanbase.
House If you're just recording a normal video, I recommend this.
Electro If it's really action-packed I recommend this.
Future Bass For laid back videos. Something not as serious but memorable.
Glitch Hop For grinding, PvP, carnage action

This is epic too! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=irkaE4ZLUng
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
That's not Dubstep, that's House.
Even Melodic Dubstep isn't close to that.

I recommend you learn a bit about EDM genres before recommending songs ;)
I admit it's a good song for YouTube, and it's free with no copyright, but it's not Dubstep.

replies.body:
Actually it depends what kind of dubstep your looking at:

Clean: I would recommend either Monstercat or NCS for "clean" dubstep.
Nasty: UFK and all those have pretty decent "nasty" tracks... I would recommend them too

BTW what do i mean by Nasty and Clean? I mean dubstep is in a lot of types... Like skrillex his dubstep (i consider) nasty, not like the song is nasty but the beat is quite harsh

(ex: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WSeNSzJ2-Jw)

Clean is not so much of a "nasty track", it keeps the smoothness of House+Drumstep+Electro (I think) :D

(ex: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0ewGL1NpD84)
 
I also recommend you check out hardstyle... Its one of my fav. genres :P

(ex: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sTxY93pA1zI)

replies.body:
There's Heavy Dubstep and "Brostep," which is what you refer to as "nasty."

Then there's chillstep and Melodic Dubstep, which is what you refer to as "clean."

UFK does have a lot of heavy dubstep tracks but I'm not sure if they can be used without a license and such. Same goes for Monstercat, but they have a bit more diversity in their song selection. I find their dubstep/drumstep selections to have a very catchy tune and good energy, which is great for a YouTube intro. Again, you'll have to check for copyright issues and licensing and all that good stuff.

Ye there is a lots of types of dubstep, i just categorize them by 2 words (Nasty and Clean).

I totally agree, But lets agree UFK has basically the drops of skrillex.. which sometimes are terrible, but in Ruffneck, its actually pretty good :P
As for melodic dubstep, it is basically as house except with minor touches.. Speaking of house, thank god tobu partnered with someone who knows how to change his style...
Btw good chillstep songs can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/user/Vexento :D

replies.body:
Okay, to clear this up... Dubstep is a genre of EDM. There are a plethora of of EDM genres and genres of EDM. 


Dubstep has a larger BPM then most songs because of the tempo. It includes many sounds to make up of a song. Sfx, lead, bass, percussion, snares, kicks, main melody, counter melody etc. I could go on forever. 


Dubstep includes a drop, which is the main objective of Dubstep. The drop can elevate or stay calm. The drop is what makes it the best part of the song. The SFX is the little sounds that gives Dubstep perfection.

There are many genres of Dubstep. Such as, liquid Dubstep, chill step, bro step, hard step, jazz step, funk step, dark step, tech step etc The list can go on forever. 


Each genre has a different rhythm to how the song is played/ the whole genre itself. 
If you're looking for something slow and blended with a steady drop, but not too heavy. You'd go with liquid Dubstep. It's more relaxed, and liquidity. It blends with the other tunes it's played with, and it's more purified. It doesn't have a larger BPM. Much more moderate than other tunes. 


If you are looking for something upbeat( like for a video) you wouldn't pick Dubstep. Dubstep can be upbeat, but it's heavy and has drops involved within the song itself ( You can, but having the main melody play throughout the whole song, is much better (:) You'd more likely go with Electro, House, Garage house, Drum-Step, Electronic b, Progressive etc. There are many upbeat and uplifting songs to choose from (-: 


Dubstep is modified for its originality of intense drops and its unique beats and sounds mixed into the song itself. Going with a Electronic genre would give a better impression of upbeat and uplifting spirt (for videos). As it carries its melody throughout the entire song. Rather than Dubstep, as it would change to another whole rhythm. (:


Having a beat change is also sick, and I'd love to see Dubstep throughout your channel! 


Skype me, as I may have some great Dubstep songs prepared for you (; I'll see what I can come up with! (: 


^^Just summing it all up x)

Chillstep
House
Progressive House
Deep House
or... DnB

You can really tell Drumstep from Electro or Dubstep, from all the drums ._.

Rather than Dubstep, as it would change to another whole rhythm. (:


Having a beat change is also sick, and I'd love to see Dubstep throughout your channel! 


Skype me, as I may have some great Dubstep songs prepared for you (; I'll see what I can come up with! (: 


^^Just summing it all up x)
reply_to.body_tagged:
Okay, to clear this up... Dubstep is a genre of EDM. There are a plethora of of EDM genres and genres of EDM. 


Dubstep has a larger BPM then most songs because of the tempo. It includes many sounds to make up of a song. Sfx, lead, bass, percussion, snares, kicks, main melody, counter melody etc. I could go on forever. 


Dubstep includes a drop, which is the main objective of Dubstep. The drop can elevate or stay calm. The drop is what makes it the best part of the song. The SFX is the little sounds that gives Dubstep perfection.

There are many genres of Dubstep. Such as, liquid Dubstep, chill step, bro step, hard step, jazz step, funk step, dark step, tech step etc The list can go on forever. 


Each genre has a different rhythm to how the song is played/ the whole genre itself. 
If you're looking for something slow and blended with a steady drop, but not too heavy. You'd go with liquid Dubstep. It's more relaxed, and liquidity. It blends with the other tunes it's played with, and it's more purified. It doesn't have a larger BPM. Much more moderate than other tunes. 


If you are looking for something upbeat( like for a video) you wouldn't pick Dubstep. Dubstep can be upbeat, but it's heavy and has drops involved within the song itself ( You can, but having the main melody play throughout the whole song, is much better (:) You'd more likely go with Electro, House, Garage house, Drum-Step, Electronic b, Progressive etc. There are many upbeat and uplifting songs to choose from (-: 


Dubstep is modified for its originality of intense drops and its unique beats and sounds mixed into the song itself. Going with a Electronic genre would give a better impression of upbeat and uplifting spirt (for videos). As it carries its melody throughout the entire song. Rather than Dubstep, as it would change to another whole rhythm. (:


Having a beat change is also sick, and I'd love to see Dubstep throughout your channel! 


Skype me, as I may have some great Dubstep songs prepared for you (; I'll see what I can come up with! (: 


^^Just summing it all up x)
